chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: Eclipse is an alternative Integrated Development Environment (IDE) which can be used with the HPCC Systems Platform. Eclipse is open source, and multi-platform and it can be used instead of the ECL IDE. The following sections cover how to install and use the ECL plug-in for Eclipse.
The ECL plug-in is also open source.

sect1.title: Prerequisites and Requirements
sect1.para: These are the basic requirements to run the Eclipse plug-in.

listitem.para: The ECL IDE (this is a temporary requirement to install the ECL compiler, eclcc, and related components).
Visual Studio 2008 or Visual Studio 2008 Express (this is only needed if you want to create local .exe files from ECL. It is not needed if you are planning on targeting a server).
Eclipse Indigo
The ECL plug-in for Eclipse

row.entry:
On a machine running Windows 7 (either the 32- or 64-bit), you must start Eclipse with administrator privileges for plug-ins to install properly. This is necessary even if your account has administrator privileges.
Right click on the Eclipse shortcut, then select Run as Administrator from the pop-up menu.

listitem.para: HPCC-Platform package (this is a temporary requirement to install the ECL compiler, eclcc, and related components, but is also useful as a local server).
64-bit desktop edition of Linux
Eclipse Indigo
The ECL plug-in for Eclipse

sect2.title: Mac (Intel based) Prerequisites:
sect2.para: Some required components have not yet been built for the Mac platform (for example, the ECLCC compiler). For the time being you can use a Windows emulator or a VM on a Mac.
Eclipse can run natively on a Mac and can be used to edit ECL files. To submit jobs there are other components needed which have not yet been built for the Mac platform.

chapter.title: Installing Eclipse
chapter.para: This section describes how to install the Eclipse IDE. If you already have the Eclipse IDE installed, skip this section and go to Installing the ECL Plug-In.

sect1.title: Getting Eclipse Indigo
sect1.para: Download the Eclipse IDE from the site:

listitem.para: Choose the Eclipse IDE for Java Developers package
Download the appropriate Eclipse IDE for your platform
Install the Eclipse IDE
In Eclipse IDE, select Help >> Install New Softwareâ€¦
Press the Add button. Install Software: Add
Provide a suitable name, for example, ECL_PlugIn.
Enter one of the locations below in the Location field

para.emphasis: NOTE: We recommend the latest stable build for production work.

row.entry: The cutting edge untested development build.

listitem.para: Disable Group items by category by clearing the checkbox. Disable Group items
Select the ECL Language box then press the Next > button.
Note: This can take a while before it appears. Select ECL Language
Review the Items to be installed and press the Next > button.
Accept the licensing agreement, then press the Finish button to complete the installation wizard.
A security warning message may appear telling you that you are installing unsigned content. Acknowledge acceptance by pressing the OK button.
After completing the wizard, it prompts you to restart eclipse. You should restart eclipse in order for the changes to take effect.

chapter.title: Using Eclipse with HPCC
chapter.para: The following sections tell you how you can use Eclipse to interact with the HPCC Platform.

sect1.title: Creating an ECL Project
sect1.para: In order to use Eclipse with an HPCC Platform, you will need to be able to create, edit, and submit ECL projects. This is how to do that with a simple "Hello World" project.

listitem.para: Open the Eclipse IDE
From the Workbench File menu, select File >> New >> Projectâ€¦
This launches a New Project window which prompts you to Select a wizard
Expand the ECL folder, select ECL Project, then press the Next button.
In the Project window, give it an appropriate name. For example, hello_world.
Press the Finish button.
When prompted to Open Associated Perspective? Press the Yes button.
Select File >> New >> Ecl Editor file.
The Multi-page Editor File window displays.
Select a container (folder) using the Browse button, then provide a name for the file, for example, hello.ecl.

row.entry: No matter what you name your project be sure you ALWAYS include the .ecl extension. The extension is required for the project to work correctly with the HPCC compiler.

listitem.para: Replace the default code in the project workspace with the following text (including the quotes): OUTPUT('Hello world');
Save your code by pressing the Save button on the toolbar, or selecting the File >> Save from the menu.

row.entry: Saving an ECL file invokes the syntax checker.

sect1.title: Execute the ECL Code
sect1.para: You can choose where to execute your ECL Code. You can execute ECL Code locally or on a server.

sect2.title: Execute your ECL Code Remotely on a Server.

listitem.para: Expand your project (hello_world), then rt-click on hello.ecl, and select Run As >> Run Configurationsâ€¦
Double click ECL Targets to create a new Run As configuration.

On the New_configuration tab enter the following:
Configuration Name
Give it an appropriate name, for example: Thor1
IP address
IP address or DNS name of the ESP server
Port
The port to use (default is 8010)
Cluster name
hthor, thor, or roxie

row.entry: Tip: Press the test button and you will see its current ECL Watch page. This lets you know you have the correct configuration.

listitem.para: Press the Apply button to save your configuration.
Press the Run button.
Click and expand the Workunit to view the Results folder.
Click on the Result to display in the Result View panel.

sect2.title: Execute your ECL Code Locally.
sect2.para: NOTE: Compiling and executing ECL code locally requires Visual Studio 2008 for Windows or GCC on Linux. You do not need these if you are targeting a server.

listitem.para: Expand the hello_world folder and right click on the hello.ecl.
Right click on your project (hello_world) and select Run As >> Local Execute (ECL).
Click and expand the Workunit to view the Results folder.
Click on the Result to display in the Result View panel.
